intro: Dammara longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved dammara, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Dammara longifolia is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
